title: How to include freelance work in an academic CV - Quora

response.answer_text: Research experience usually refers to laboratory or experimental work in which a study is made, results compiled and a report made. If this report passes an authoritative review and is approved for publication, the reference to the report can be listed after the record of the years spent in research. Typically, a curriculum vitae has sections titled: Education Experience Research (this can be the same as experience) Example of an included publication May 1980- Jun 1980 Research assistant contributed to x study by Prof. Y. Authors, Title, Publisher, copyright date, where your name is listed as an author or contributor. Awards Publications The latter category is used for any publication, research results driven or not. In this section, follow the recommended style guide for citing publications. Eg. Author, Title, Publisher, copyright date, where you are listed as an author or editor.
